result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC 5th. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC 5th was dismissed by the court.

  • Valeria V Gordon was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 months.

miscConds.notes: $1,519 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain absolute sobriety. Def shall not use or possess alcohol. Def shall not be in any liquor store, bar, tavern or any place whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
W/ Huber. Provisions of good time apply.
8/3/15 Crt orders that the def is entitled to 2 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valeria V Gordon

records.addlTxt: on petition for early discharge from probation. Effective 10/2/17
Motion hearing on October 2, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation
Defn petitioning court for an early release from probation. Copies sent to Probation Agent
for Jail Credit; 2 days credit.  Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on December 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on November 13, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:47
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Daniel Craig Musser.  Robert John Kaiser, Jr. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Per Rotation Order, incoming branch 2 judge, Josann Reynolds, shall be assigned all open cases previously assigned to former branch 2 judge, Maryann Sumi.
Status conference on October 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 2

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Daniel Craig Musser.  Andrea B. Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
